title: Notice of forfeiture proceedings
context: §712A-8 Notice of forfeiture proceedings. Unless otherwise provided, whenever notice is required under this chapter it shall be given in one of the following ways: (a) If the owner&rsquo;s or interest-holder&rsquo;s name and current address are known: (i) By personal service; or (ii) By mail; (b) If the owner&rsquo;s or interest-holder&rsquo;s interest is required by law to be on record with a state or federal agency in order to perfect an interest in the property, but the person&rsquo;s current address is not known, by mailing a copy of the notice by certified mail to any address on the record; or &copy; If the owner&rsquo;s or interest-holder&rsquo;s address is not known, and is not on record pursuant to paragraph (b), or if the person&rsquo;s interest is not known, by publication in one issue of a newspaper of general circulation in the county in which the seizure occurs. [L 1988, c 260, pt of §1, §7; am L 1990, c 197, §1; am L 1991, c 166, §3; am L 1993, c 196, §1; am L 1996, c 104, §6]
